intro: Eriogonum ochrocephalum var. breedlovei, commonly known as the Breddle's buckwheat, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Polygonaceae family, characterized by its basal leaves and showy, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. Its flowers, which range in color from yellow to reddish-brown, bloom in late spring to early summer. This variety is distinguished by its unique leaf morphology and is of interest to botanists and conservationists due to its limited distribution.
